dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5642 IH: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 47 Echo Avenue in Miller Place, New York, as the “Christopher Pendergast Post Office Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. LaLota (for himself, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Kennedy of New York, and Mr. Lawler) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 47 Echo Avenue in Miller Place, New York, as the Christopher Pendergast Post Office Building.

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 47 Echo Avenue in Miller Place, New York, shall be known and designated as the Christopher Pendergast Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Christopher Pendergast Post Office Building.
